intro: Vanhouttea bradeana, commonly known as the Bradeana vanhouttea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The tree is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
